article.Heading: Union Budget 2016-17: Nifty breaks 7000, Sensex falls over 100pts; market snubs Budget
article.Summary: FMCG index is down 1.3 percent, while Bankex is on the verge of slipping into red. GAIL, Wipro, Infosys, Maruti and Hero are top losers.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

The market has started its downtrend journey, snubbing Finance Minister Arun Jaitley's Budget proposals at the moment. The Sensex is down 122.79 points or 0.5 percent at 23031.51 and the Nifty is down 37.85 points or 0.5 percent at 6991.90. About 908 shares have advanced, 1173 shares declined, and 133 shares are unchanged.

FMCG index is down 1.3 percent, while Bankex is on the verge of slipping into red. GAIL, Wipro, Infosys, Maruti and Hero are top losers.

Here are few Budget proposals

Allocate Rs 55,000 Cr for roads highways exclusive Rs 15000 cr for NHAI bonds
To pay 8.33 percent for new employees towards EPFO contribution for 3 years 
To set up high education financing agency with Rs 1000 cr capital
Propose to exempt parts of dialysis equipment from basic customs duty
Propose to launch new health care scheme with Rs 1 lakh as cover per family

Posted by Nasrin Sultana
Follow @NasrinzStory
